change.item: This finding aid was updated in alignment with LC EAD 2.0 specifications using a python script created by Erik Radio.

did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Until Tomorrow: or, Time Does Strange Things 1940-1954
did.abstract: Original typescript, with handwritten edits in ink. Divided into two books, this work tells the story of a Jewish family during the reign of Hitler in Germany. Book one recounts the family's history and their deprivation and suffering at the hands of the Nazis. Book two tells about the family's new life in New York, after fleeing Germany.

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized by book number.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Original typescript, with handwritten edits in ink. Divided into two books, this work tells the story of a Jewish family during the reign of Hitler in Germany. Book one recounts the family's history and their deprivation and suffering at the hands of the Nazis. Book two tells about the family's new life in New York, after fleeing Germany.
This work was possibly written for a motion picture by Edith Levayne.
